article_title: Defense Department Official on the Benefits of Austerity.
article_text:
"I'm one of those people who believes that austerity is not necessarily bad. I think that there is some good that comes from this. I've been in organizations before where in times of declining budgets, we have actually been able to innovate and do the kind of thinking about the future that we weren't able to do when there was a lot of money out there."

Lt. Gen. Robert E. Schmidle Jr., U.S. Marine Corps, Principal Deputy Director of Cost Assessment and Program Evaluation, U.S. Defense Department...

twitter.description: Declining budgets can encourage innovation and forward thinking, Lt. Gen. Robert E. Schmidle Jr. of the Defense Department tells The Wall Street Journal's CFO Network conference.
twitter.title: Voices From the CFO Network Conference

image.alt: The upside of austerity: innovation and forward thinking, Defense Department official says.

"I'm one of those people who believes that austerity is not necessarily bad.
I think that there is some good that comes from this.
I've been in organizations before where in times of declining budgets, we have actually been able to innovate and do the kind of thinking about the future that we weren't able to do when there was a lot of money out there."
